channel.title: Pages on Yanzhang Xu's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Yanzhang Xu's Blog

item.title: Abot Me
item.description:
Yanzhang Xu (许彦章)
I am currently a Ph.D. student (2023-Present) in Material and Science Engineering at the

Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Singpore

, under the supervision of

Prof. Cho Namjoon

and

Prof. Song Juha

. I earned my master's degree in Naval Architecture and Ocean Engineering from

Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU)

, where I was advisied by

Prof. Decheng Wan

.
My research focus on the computational fluid dynamics (CFD) and computational sloid mechanics . For the fluid dynamic, the fluid-sructure interaction issue (vortex induced vibration of the marine paltform, turbine blades and ships) have been studied via the numerical method including the commerical software (COMSOL, FLUENT) and open scources software (

OpenFoam

). For the solid mechanic, the second development of ABAQUS with Python has been applied to investeaget the hierarchical metamaterial inspired from the nature ( wood, lobster, shells etc.), which can resist the impacting force and be used to design the protecting gears.
Recently, the numerical method (FEM via ABAQUS and MD simulation via

Gromacs

) will be applied to study the mechanical properties of the biomaterial (Biocompatible polymer and hydrogel) combined with the 3D bioprinter from the macro and micro-scales. The Al algorithm will be also considered in the simulation in order to accelarate the simulation process. In the future, I plan to dive into the area of AI4Science to produce the high quality and low cost products which can rapidly improve our life qualites.
If you want to cooperate in the AI4Science area, feel free to contact me via the email:

YANZHANG002@e.ntu.edu.sg

.

Education
✔ 2023 Fall - 2026 Winter: Nanyang Technological University (NTU)，Singapore. Ph.D at Material and Science Engineering (Expect end of the 2026).
✔ 2020 Fall - 2023 Summer: Northeastern University (NEU)，Boston, MA, U.S. Ph.D (Drop due to the visa) at Mechanical Engineering.
✔ 2017 Fall - 2020 Summer: Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU 上海交通大学)，Shanghai, China, M.Sc at Naval Architecture and Ocean Engineering.
✔ 2014 Fall - 2017 Summer: Wuhan University (WHU 武汉大学)，Wuhan, China, B.S.(Minor) at Economics.
✔ 2013 Fall - 2017 Summer: Huazhong University of Science and Technology (HUST 华中科技大学)，Wuhan, China, B.S. at Naval Architecture and Ocean Engineering.

Activity
✔ 2024 Fall - 2024 Winter:Mentor of the undergraduate student for the final year project, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore
✔ 2023 Fall - 2024 Winter: Teaching Assistant, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore.
✔ 2020 Fall - 2023 Summer: Reseach Assistant, Northeastern University, Boston, U.S.
✔ 2020 Fall - 2021 Summer: Online Instructor, Teach math and physics at the junior high school level.

Publication
J1. Xu, Yan Zhang and Nash, Richard and Batwa, Ammar and Li, Yaning. "Auxetic Two-Phase Chevron Mechanical Metamaterial". Advanced Engineering Materials,vol.26,no.16,p.2400 691,2024.

[pdf]


J2. Xu, Yan Zhang and Zhao, Wei Wen and Wan, De Cheng. "MPS method for interaction between solitary waves and submerged horizontal plate". China Ocean Engineering,vol.34,pp.314-327,2020.

[pdf]


C1. Xu, Yan Zhang and Zhou, Chen Chen and Song, Juha and Cho, Namjoon. "Unravelling the Size and Shape Tuning Mechanisms of Microparticle Formation in Pollen-Hydrogel Composites". In 2024 SES Annual Technical Meeting，Hangzhou, China,2024.

[pdf].


C2. Xu, Yan Zhang and Nash, Richard and Li, Yaning. "Mechanics of Two-Phase Auxetic Chevron Mechanical Metamaterial". APS March Meeting 2022 Abstracts,W21--012,Chicago, U.S.,2022.

[pdf]


C3. Xu, Yan Zhang and Li, Yaning. "Retarding Damages/Cracks via Auxetic effects and Snap-through Instability". APS March Meeting 2021 Abstracts,X17--009,2021.

[pdf]


C4. Xu, Yan Zhang and Zhang, Guanyu and Wan, Decheng and Chen, Gang. "MPS Method for Study of Interactions Between Solitary Wave and Submerged Horizontal Plate". In the 29th International Ocean and Polar Engineering，Honolulu, Hawaii, USA,2019.

[pdf]
